question: Match the following:
columnA: Predominant stage in moss life cycle
Attachment of leafy stage in mosses

question: Match the following:
columnA: Location of sex organs in mosses
Structure where spores are formed in moss
columnB: Fragmentation and budding in the secondary protonema
At the apex of the leafy shoots

answer.Vegetative reproduction in mosses: Fragmentation and budding in the secondary protonema
answer.Location of sex organs in mosses: At the apex of the leafy shoots

question: Match the following:
columnB: Cool, damp, shady places though some may flourish well in sandy-soil conditions
Microphylls as in Selaginella or large (macrophylls) as in ferns
Subtended by leaf-like appendages called sporophylls

answer.Pteridophyte habitat: Cool, damp, shady places though some may flourish well in sandy-soil conditions
answer.Types of pteridophyte leaves: Microphylls as in Selaginella or large (macrophylls) as in ferns
answer.Sporangia location: Subtended by leaf-like appendages called sporophylls

question: Match the following:
columnA: Structure formed by sporophylls in some pteridophytes
Germination product of spores in pteridophytes
columnB: Distinct compact structures called strobili or cones
By meiosis in spore mother cells

answer.Structure formed by sporophylls in some: Distinct compact structures called strobili or cones
answer.Spore mother cell division type: By meiosis in spore mother cells
